alert.note: Alert for Medina; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 10:30PM EDT until July 20 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Cuyahoga, Medina and Summit. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Cuyahoga Falls, Strongsville, Brunswick, North Royalton, Kent, Barberton, Solon, Hudson, Wadsworth, Twinsburg, Tallmadge, Streetsboro, Macedonia, Rittman, Mogadore, Stow, Broadview Heights, Aurora and Brecksville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
